result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Party Address Sealed by Judge Needham
NOH (INIT) returned by PO. Moved, left no address. Unable to forward. Return to sender. olg

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cenex Co Op.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:52 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Leah Marie Clausing in court.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Leah Marie Clausing.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does qualify for PD.  Atty Schmidt asking DE's address not be read out loud.  DE to  confirm address when reading bond. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG. Adjourned at 1:54 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court cannot hear DE over zoom.  Court questions DE on appearance in person.  Court reschedules this matter to next week for an in person appearance. Adjourned at 2:12 PM. bph
